content.value_statement: Building responsive web layouts that work across all devices is complex and error-prone. This skill provides Claude with clear guidelines on mobile-first design principles, fluid containers, relative units, and touch-friendly interactions to ensure your web projects scale seamlessly from mobile to desktop.
actual_capabilities: Implement mobile-first responsive layouts with proper breakpoints
Choose appropriate sizing units (rem, em, %, vw, vh) for different scenarios
Create fluid grids and flexible container systems
Optimize touch targets for mobile users
Test UI components across different screen sizes and devices
Apply responsive typography and font scaling techniques
limitations: Provides guidance only - does not generate or modify code files directly
Does not include live browser testing or visual preview capabilities
Does not provide device-specific CSS frameworks or libraries
Does not include accessibility audit or color contrast validation

prompt_templates.title: Basic responsive layout
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a responsive container for my web page that works on mobile, tablet, and desktop using the mobile-first approach.

prompt_templates.title: Media query breakpoints
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the standard breakpoints I should use for a mobile-first responsive design? Show me how to implement them in CSS.

prompt_templates.title: Sizing units selection
prompt_templates.prompt: When should I use rem vs em vs px vs vw/vh for sizing in responsive layouts? Give me practical examples for each.

prompt_templates.title: Touch-friendly design
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I ensure my buttons and interactive elements are touch-friendly on mobile devices? What are the minimum sizing requirements?

output_examples.input: Create a responsive card component that stacks on mobile and displays side-by-side on desktop
output: Mobile-first: Start with stacked layout for small screens
Use flexbox or grid for desktop side-by-side arrangement
Add breakpoint around 768px for tablet and up
Ensure minimum 44px touch targets for buttons
Use rem units for spacing that scales with base font

best_practices: Start with mobile styles and use min-width media queries to progressively enhance for larger screens
Use relative units (rem, em) for typography and spacing to support user zoom preferences
Test on actual devices or reliable emulators, not just browser resizing tools
anti_patterns: Avoid designing desktop-first and trying to simplify for mobile - this often results in poor mobile experiences
Do not use fixed pixel widths for containers - use max-width with percentage or viewport units instead
Avoid hiding content on mobile without providing alternative access - consider content priority strategies

faq.question: What is mobile-first responsive design?
faq.answer: Mobile-first is an approach where you start designing for the smallest screens first, then progressively enhance the layout for larger screens using min-width media queries.

faq.question: What are the standard breakpoints for responsive design?
faq.answer: Common breakpoints are: mobile (up to 640px), tablet (641-1024px), and desktop (1025px and up). Adjust based on your specific content needs.

faq.question: How does this skill integrate with CSS frameworks?
faq.answer: This skill works with any CSS framework including Tailwind, Bootstrap, and custom CSS. It provides general principles that apply regardless of the framework used.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill contains only prompt guidance. It does not access files, networks, or execute code. All processing happens within your development environment.

faq.question: Why are my layouts breaking on specific devices?
faq.answer: Layout issues often stem from improper breakpoint placement, fixed pixel widths, or missing viewport meta tags. Check that your container widths use relative units and that touch targets meet minimum size requirements.

faq.question: How is this different from other responsive design tools?
faq.answer: Unlike visual design tools, this skill provides coding guidance and best practices that integrate directly into your development workflow with Claude Code.
